subject: Policy guidelines for release of Land Acquisition Notifications in the newspapers.
text: HRdy <74tly <THNf xifedrut TM _ Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (er War ak_{roTATf 1A1c4) YaM Fax : 91-11-25093507 25093514 MI V National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 5-5 & 6, %azr-10 , Ekqal, # @ert-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, Delhi-110075 NHAV Policy Guidelines/ Land Acquisition Notifications/ 2019 No.4.24/2019 dated the O1st August, 2019 (Decision taken on file no.11041/35/18-MR) Sub: Policy  guidelines for release of Land   Acquisition Notifications in the Newspapers. Following policy guidelines shall be followed for publishing Land Acquisition notifications in the newspapers: (a) Land   Acquisition Notifications shall be released by the concerned Regional Office through a advertising agency or to the newspapers directly on DAVP rates, as per the laid down guidelines: In case of releasing the notification through an advertising agency, it shall be released through the agencies empanelled with respective RO only, as per the roster. (b) In order to maintain uniformity, the notifications shall be released as the specifications placed at Annexure A & B'_ ROs shall ensure that the per specifications are followed for all LA notifications. (c) Font of the text shall be Arial/Arial Narrow in 7 point in English and Narad 8 in Hindi for running text: (d) While notification under Section 34 gives only brief description of land, notification under 3D provides details of landowners; The column bearing details of Iand owners in 3D occupies more space and results in higher column height; while other columns have lesser text resulting in Wastage-of space: Hence, the column having more text, in general, should have more width as illustrated at Annexure 'C' and D' Text of 3A notification may preferably be published by dividing the page of   newspaper in three columns, while 3D notification may be published in two columns. Due diligence should be done while adjusting text in rows and columns So that the notification' occupies minimum possible space to keep expenditure at minimum possible level to observe economy. (e) Notification shall be published in two newspapers, circulating strictly in local edition of the area only, of which one must be in vernacular Language of the notifications   should be same as that of the language. Notification under section 3D or subsequent notices for the same peecepapetandoshal be published in the same set of newspapers in which piece notification under section 3A was published: FIQL NHAI New point
